metadata.title: CVE-2022-41556 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A resource leak in gw_backend.c in lighttpd 1.4.56 through 1.4.66 couldlead to a denial of service (connection-slot exhaustion) after a largeamount of anomalous TCP behavior by clients. It is related to RDHUPmishandling in certain HTTP/1.1 chunked situations. Use of mod_fastcgi is,for example, affected. This is fixed in 1.4.67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-gnutls - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-wolfssl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-dbi - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-lua - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.67-1ubuntu2').
